pattern.name: Frequency
pattern.description:
Relative frequency of the given nominal value in the population.
Based on Learning Feature Engineering for Classification from Nargesian, this pattern should incur performance improvement for the majority of attributes. Similar observation is described in: CatBoost: gradient boosting with categorical features support from Dorogush.
pattern.example: Frequency of the client's name - which tells us, whether the client is a foreigner, or not. And based on that we can offer him/her different products.
pattern.author: Jan Motl
pattern.code: WITH intermediate AS ( SELECT count(*) row_count FROM @propagatedTable ) SELECT t1.@base , 1.0 * count(t1.@baseId) over (partition by t1.@nominalColumn)/t2.row_count AS @columnName FROM @propagatedTable t1, intermediate t2
